articles.title: AIs can generate near-verbatim copies of novels from training data
articles.description: LLMs memorize more training data than previously thought.
articles.content: The world‚Äôs top AI models can be prompted to generate near-verbatim copies of bestselling novels, raising fresh questions about the industry‚Äôs claim that its systems do not store copyrighted works. A series of recent studies has shown that large language models from OpenAI, Google, Meta, Anthropic, and xAI memorize far more of their training data than previously thought. AI and legal experts told the FT this ‚Äúmemorization‚Äù ability could have serious ramifications on AI groups‚Äô battle against doz
articles.author: Melissa Heikkil√§, Financial Times

articles.content: Discord is attempting to distance itself from the age verification provider Persona following a steady stream of user backlash. In an emailed statement to The Verge , Discord's head of product policy, Savannah Badalich, confirms the company "ran a limited test of Persona in the UK where age assurance had previously launched and that test has since concluded." After Discord announced plans to implement age verification globally starting next month , users across social media accused Discord of "l

articles.title: Study shows how rocket launches pollute the atmosphere
articles.description: Is the global atmospheric commons destined to be an industrial waste dumping ground?
articles.content: New research published Thursday bolsters growing concerns that a handful of companies and countries are using the global atmospheric commons as a dumping ground for potentially toxic and climate-altering industrial waste byproducts from loosely regulated commercial space flights. The new study analyzed a plume of pollution trailing part of a Falcon rocket that crashed through the upper atmosphere on Feb. 19, 2025, after SpaceX lost control of its reentry. The rocket was launched earlier that mon
articles.author: Bob Berwyn, Inside Climate News

articles.title: A Privacy LLM Inference Engine That Runs on $10 Hardware
articles.description: Three facts define the problem A3S Power was built to solve: One: Every prompt you send to any LLM inference server exists in plaintext in server memory. Ollama, vLLM, TGI, llama.cpp ‚Äî no exceptions. Operators promise they "won't look," but that's policy, not physics. Two: A quantized 10B-parameter
articles.content: Three facts define the problem A3S Power was built to solve: One: Every prompt you send to any LLM inference server exists in plaintext in server memory. Ollama, vLLM, TGI, llama.cpp ‚Äî no exceptions. Operators promise they "won't look," but that's policy, not physics. Two: A quantized 10B-parameter model requires 6GB of memory. TEE (Trusted Execution Environment) encrypted memory is typically only 256MB. Traditional inference engines under this constraint can only run 0.5B toy models ‚Äî incapable
articles.author: Roy Lin

articles.content: Early on the morning of September 2, 2024, a Chicago Transit Authority Blue Line train was the scene of a random and horrific mass shooting. Four people were shot and killed on a westbound train as it approached the suburb of Forest Park. The police swiftly activated a digital dragnet‚Äîa surveillance network that connects thousands of cameras in the city. articles.title: Three Ways MCP Servers Handle Authentication (and Why Passive Scanning Misses One)
articles.description: Three Ways MCP Servers Handle Authentication (and Why You Need Active Testing to Know Which) I spent the last month scanning 525 MCP servers. One finding surprised me: passive scanning classifies 38 servers incorrectly . Here's the problem. The Three Tiers After scanning 525 MCP servers, I've found
articles.content: Three Ways MCP Servers Handle Authentication (and Why You Need Active Testing to Know Which) I spent the last month scanning 525 MCP servers. One finding surprised me: passive scanning classifies 38 servers incorrectly . Here's the problem. The Three Tiers After scanning 525 MCP servers, I've found that they cluster into three distinct authentication architectures. Understanding which tier a server uses requires different testing approaches ‚Äî and most existing scanners only detect Tier 3. Tier 1
articles.author: kai_security_ai

According to a report from The Sunday Times , Lamborghini has abandoned making a production version of the Lanzador EV concept, which was expected to hit the market in 2029. Stephen Winke
articles.content: Looks like we won't get to hear the powerful hum of an all-electric Lamborghini on the streets anytime soon. According to a report from The Sunday Times , Lamborghini has abandoned making a production version of the Lanzador EV concept, which was expected to hit the market in 2029. Stephen Winkelmann, chairman and CEO of Lamborghini, told The Sunday Times that there was "close to zero" interest from its customer base for battery-powered EVs. Winkelmann also revealed that the verdict to kill
articles.author: Jackson Chen
